title: مَا الْكَافَّةُ وَالْمَكْفُوفَةُ
titleEn: The Neutralizing Ma and Neutralized Particles
description: Learn about مَا الكافة - the ما that prevents particles from governing, and the مكفوف particles (إِنَّمَا، رُبَّمَا، كَأَنَّمَا) that lose their governance when ما is attached.

notes.title: What is مَا الكافة?
content: مَا الكافة (the neutralizing ما) is a particle that attaches to certain governing words and 'neutralizes' or prevents (كَفَّ) them from exercising their grammatical governance. The word it attaches to becomes مَكْفُوف (neutralized/prevented).
This is different from مَا الزائدة (extra ما) which is added for emphasis but doesn't change governance. مَا الكافة actually changes the grammatical behavior of the particle it attaches to.

examples.english: Indeed Zayd is standing (إِنَّ governs)
Zayd is only standing (إِنَّمَا doesn't govern)
Many a man I met (رُبَّ governs genitive)
Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish (رُبَّمَا precedes verb)

notes.title: إِنَّمَا - Restriction Particle
content: When مَا الكافة attaches to إِنَّ, it becomes إِنَّمَا which has two effects: 1) إِنَّ loses its governance (no longer takes اسم منصوب), 2) The compound إِنَّمَا now means حَصْر (restriction/only).
After إِنَّمَا, the sentence structure returns to normal مبتدأ + خبر (both nominative). إِنَّمَا can also precede verbs, which إِنَّ alone cannot do.
keyPoints: إِنَّمَا: loses governance, gains meaning of حَصْر
Can precede nominal sentences or verbs

examples.english: The believers are only brothers (Quran 49:10)

examples.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَخْشَى اللهَ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ الْعُلَمَاءُ
examples.english: Only the scholars fear Allah among His servants (Quran 35:28)
Actions are only by intentions (Hadith)
You are only a warner (Quran 13:7)

notes.title: رُبَّمَا - Perhaps
content: When مَا الكافة attaches to رُبَّ (particle of paucity/abundance), it becomes رُبَّمَا. This prevents رُبَّ from requiring a مجرور noun after it, allowing رُبَّمَا to precede verbs.
رُبَّمَا retains the meaning of رُبَّ (perhaps/many a) but with expanded usage. It commonly precedes verbs in classical Arabic and Quran.

examples.arabic: رُبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ كَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ
examples.english: Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish they had been Muslims (Quran 15:2)
Perhaps I have ascended to a peak (poetry)
Perhaps souls hate from a matter...
Perhaps a person regrets

notes.title: كَأَنَّمَا - As If
content: When مَا الكافة attaches to كَأَنَّ (as if), it becomes كَأَنَّمَا. This prevents كَأَنَّ from governing (no اسم منصوب), and allows it to precede both nominal sentences and verbs.
كَأَنَّمَا retains the meaning of comparison/simile (تشبيه) but with greater flexibility in sentence structure.
keyPoints: كَأَنَّ alone: takes اسم منصوب + خبر
Both mean: as if, as though

examples.english: As if they are frightened donkeys (كَأَنَّ governs)
As if they are being driven to death (Quran 8:6)
As if their faces are covered (Quran 10:27)
As if he is climbing into the sky (Quran 6:125)

notes.title: Other Particles with مَا الكافة
content: Besides إِنَّ، رُبَّ، كَأَنَّ, other particles can take مَا الكافة: لَعَلَّمَا (perhaps), لَيْتَمَا (if only - rare), طَالَمَا (as long as), قَلَّمَا (rarely). Each loses its original governance.
The pattern is consistent: particle + مَا = loss of governance + preserved or modified meaning. This is a productive pattern in classical Arabic.
keyPoints: طَالَمَا: as long as, for a long time

examples.english: I have advised you for so long
He rarely does that
Perhaps he will succeed
But He is only one God (إِنَّمَا variant)

notes.title: مَا الكافة vs مَا الزائدة
notes.titleArabic: الْفَرْقُ بَيْنَ مَا الْكَافَّةِ وَمَا الزَّائِدَةِ
content: It's essential to distinguish مَا الكافة from مَا الزائدة. مَا الكافة changes grammar (prevents governance). مَا الزائدة adds emphasis without changing grammar.
Test: if removing مَا changes the grammatical structure, it's مَا الكافة. If removing مَا only removes emphasis but grammar stays the same, it's مَا الزائدة.
keyPoints: Test: does removing مَا change structure?
Context and resulting structure determine type

examples.english: Zayd is only standing (مَا changes structure)
By [what is] mercy (مَا adds emphasis, جَرّ remains)
Perhaps he regrets (verb follows - مَا changed structure)
Wherever you may be (شرط structure unchanged)

exercises.prompt: مَا الَّتِي تَمْنَعُ الْحَرْفَ مِنَ الْعَمَلِ تُسَمَّى مَا _____
exercises.promptEn: The مَا that prevents a particle from governing is called مَا _____

exercises.prompt: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِخْوَةٌ - إِنَّمَا هُنَا تُفِيدُ معنى _____
exercises.promptEn: The believers are only brothers - إِنَّمَا here conveys the meaning of _____

exercises.prompt: رُبَّ تَدْخُلُ عَلَى الاِسْمِ، أَمَّا رُبَّمَا فَتَدْخُلُ عَلَى _____
exercises.promptEn: رُبَّ enters on nouns, while رُبَّمَا enters on _____

exercises.prompt: الْحَرْفُ الَّذِي مُنِعَ مِنَ الْعَمَلِ بِسَبَبِ مَا الْكَافَّةِ يُسَمَّى _____
exercises.promptEn: The particle prevented from governing by مَا الكافة is called _____

exercises.prompt: كَأَنَّ تَعْمَلُ عَمَلَ إِنَّ، أَمَّا كَأَنَّمَا فَ_____ عَنِ الْعَمَلِ
exercises.promptEn: كَأَنَّ works like إِنَّ, but كَأَنَّمَا is _____ from working

exercises.prompt: مَا الزَّائِدَةُ تُضِيفُ التَّوْكِيدَ، أَمَّا مَا الْكَافَّةُ فَتُغَيِّرُ _____
exercises.promptEn: مَا الزائدة adds emphasis, while مَا الكافة changes _____

exercises.prompt: إِنَّ combined with مَا الكافة, meaning 'only' or 'indeed only'
رُبَّ combined with مَا الكافة, can precede verbs
كَأَنَّ combined with مَا الكافة, meaning 'as if'
